content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are sitting around the kitchen table as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey uh Mon, I saw the Porsche parked out front, can I get the keys? Thought I’d take that bad boy out for a little spin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute! (To Monica) You let Ross drive the Porsche and when I ask you, you say you’re the only one who’s allowed to drive it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well he’s my brother! And plus he drives so slow he could never hurt it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a car Monica! Not a rocket ship!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whatever Ross! Just replace the bulbs in the brake lights after you’re done.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Saw the Porsche out there Mon, lookin’ good. When do I get to take that baby out again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You let Joey drive it?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve never driven it! Okay? Not once! Okay once. Okay, I drive it all the time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice work everybody! So much for the y’know, “You can drive it, but don’t tell Rachel” plan!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I can’t believe you lied to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I can fix this! Okay Monica, Rachel thinks all you can talk about is the wedding. (Rachel glares at her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great! Well Rachel, the reason why I won’t let you drive the Porsche is because you’re a terrible driver. There! That wasn’t about the wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Rach if-if you want to go for a ride in the Porsche I’ll be glad to take you for a quick spin around the block.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you got a couple hours?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is there as Ross enters with all his hair sticking straight up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whew! That was a brisk ride!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Take the top down did ya?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Only way to fly.
(Rachel laughs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Ross give me the keys! Monica does not know what she’s talking about! I am an excellent driver!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re fast and irresponsible. That adds up to a bad driver.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well in High School, that added up to head cheerleader.
(A woman walks by and smiles at Ross’s hair.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you see the look that girl just gave me? Huh? She must’ve seen me cruising in the bad boy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think she’s checking out your beehive Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! (Checks his hair.) Give-give me a brush.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gimme the keys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well no brush!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine! Y’know what? It doesn’t matter, because, if I remember correctly, there is a comb on the floor of the bathroom.
(He goes to the bathroom and after he leaves Rachel goes through his coat and grabs the keys along with a $20 bill. The woman from before watches her do this.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alimony. (Runs outside.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Phoebe are counting the invitations as Chandler exits from the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, we still haven’t gotten an RSVP from your dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Right. Umm, maybe that’s because I didn’t send him an invitation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! He’s your father; he should be at the wedding.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t even know the man. Okay? We’re not that close. I haven’t seen him in years.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well what are you gonna do when he finds out he wasn’t even asked?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well he doesn’t have to know! It’s not like we run in the same circles. I hang out with you guys, and he stars in a drag show in Vegas.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I think I wanna trade circles.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Trust me, you don’t want him there either. Okay? Nobody is gonna be staring at the bride when the father of the groom is wearing a back-less dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what! As long as he’s not wearing a white dress and a veil I don’t care.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I think I need to do some shopping. (Gets up and leaves.)

content.description: A Street, Rachel is throwing her coat into the Porsche and getting in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahhh! (Gets in.) Ooh, nice!
(Suddenly from out of nowhere Ross dives onto the hood.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you think you’re doing?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just washing the windshield. (She turns on the wipers forcing Ross off of the hood.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There is no way I am letting you drive this car! So why don’t you just hand over the keys?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

{Transcriber’s Note: She puts the key into the ignition, which is on the left side of the steering wheel. Does anyone know why that is? It’s a tradition left over from Porsche’s racing history. The world’s greatest endurance race is the 24 Hours of LeMans. Which is in France and runs for 24 hours straight from noon on Saturday through the dark of night and finishes at noon on Sunday. In the 60s LeMans had a unique start where the drivers would actually start the race outside of the car and across the track. At the start of the race, the drivers would run across the track, get in the car, buckle up, start the car, and drive off. Porsche wanted to reduce the amount of time that took. Since all cars to that point had the ignition switches on the right side of the steering wheel, that required the drivers to use their right hand to grab the seat-belts, put the car in gear and start it. The driver’s left hand did nothing. Porsche in order to save a few seconds in a 24-hour race; moved the ignition switches to the left side of the steering wheel so that the driver could start the car with his left hand while grabbing the seat-belts with his right hand. That’s why every Porsche car built since then has the ignition on the left side of the steering wheel.}

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No ah-ah-ah! Do not start this car! (She starts the car.) Okay! Okay! I will give you twenty bucks if you get out of this car right now! (He looks for the twenty Rachel stole and doesn’t find it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Ross, if you’re so freaked out, just get in the car!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: With you?! Yeah right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. (She starts off.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay! Okay! (He gets in, but into the back seat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you doing?! Get in the front!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In the death seat?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my…
(They drive off.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are on the couch as a man enters.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey sweetie!

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Ready to go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Sure! Ooh, I left my purse up at Monica’s. I’ll be right back. (She goes to get it.)

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Wait a minute!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? (He leans in to kiss her.) Oh. (They kiss and Phoebe pauses.) Ooh. (Pause) Whoa! That one kept going. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So! You and Phoebe huh? How long have you been going out?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Over a month.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Maybe uh, maybe you and I ought to get to know each other a little better.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Sure, I’d like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh, what’s your name?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: It’s Jake.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey. (They shake hands.) Hey Jake, do you like the Knicks?

content.speaker: Jake
content.text: Yeah, big fan.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too! There’s a game on Tuesday, do you wanna go?

content.speaker: Jake
content.text: Yeah that would be great! Let me make sure I’m not doing anything Tuesday. (He bends over to open his bag, when he does so his pants slide down his butt revealing a pink lace secret.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is entering from the bedroom carrying two bags of luggage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here! (She sets a bag down in front of him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s your suitcase. We’re going to Las Vegas.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you serious?! I mean like eloping?! No more stupid wedding stuff?! No more these flowers or these flowers or these flowers—Think of the money we’ll save!! (Monica just looks at him.) We’re not eloping. I love the flowers. Can our wedding be bigger please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re going to Las Vegas to see your dad. It’s time you two talked, and I want to get to know my father-in-law.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know we already went over this and I won!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you didn’t. Oh and honey, just so you know, now that you’re marrying me, you don’t get to win anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look forget it okay? I don’t want to go. I don’t want to see him. I don’t wanna.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, look I-I know that your dad embarrassed you. I know…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no all kids are embarrassed by their parents, you’d have to come up with a whole new word for what I went through. When I was in High School, he used to come to all of my swim meets dressed as a different Hollywood starlet. Y’know it’s hard enough to be fourteen. You’re skinny. You’re wearing speedos—That your mom promised that you would grow into! And you look up into the stands and there’s your dad cheering you on dressed as Carmen Miranda. He was wearing a headdress with real fruit that he will later hand out to your friends as a healthy snack!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, the point is that he was at every one of your swim meets and he was there cheering you on! Okay? That’s a, that’s a pretty great dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He had sex with Mr. Garibaldi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who’s Mr. Garibaldi?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does it matter?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, you’re not fourteen anymore. Okay? Maybe it’s time that you let that stuff go. If your father’s not at your wedding…you’re gonna regret it for the rest of your life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah o-okay, but I’m just doing this for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I really never get to win anymore?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How much did ever really win before?

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, you know how uh, when you’re wearing pants and you lean forward I check out your underwear?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, when Jake did it I saw that…he was wearing women’s underwear!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. They were mine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. (Laughs.) No! No wait, that’s weird!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s not! We were just goofing around and I dared him to try them on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s weird!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m wearing his briefs right now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s…kinda hot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think so too. And that little flap? Great for holding my lipstick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I wouldn’t know about that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And! Y’know what Jake says? That women’s underwear is actually more comfortable. And he loves the way the silk feels against his skin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah well next thing you know, he’ll be telling you that your high heels are good for his posture!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There is nothing wrong with Jake! Okay? He is all man! I’m thinking even more than you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, he looked like a real lumberjack in those pink lacys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just saying that only a man completely secure with his masculinity could walk around in women’s underwear! I don’t think you could ever do that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I am secure with my masculinity.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, whatever.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’ve seen my huge stack of porn, right? (Phoebe nods.)

content.description: The Porsche, Rachel is driving along a highway and Ross has finally moved to the death seat and is terrified.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God. I forgot how much I love driving. I have got to get my license renewed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t have a valid driver’s license—Okay that is it! Pull over right now!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross you’re so tense! You just gotta relax, okay? Just need to relax all right? Just need to relax… (She takes her hands off of the wheel.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What-what are you doing?! Are you—Okay that’s not funny! Just stop horsing around!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am not horsing around, okay? I am Porsching around.
(Suddenly a siren goes off behind them.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-oh. (She starts to pull over.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, stay calm. Nothing is going to happen to you, you are not in that much trouble.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? You think so?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was talking to myself! You’re going down!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is walking from the bathroom to his bedroom and walks past a pile of Rachel’s laundry, which just happens to include a selection of panties. He stops, goes back to the basket, looks for Rachel, picks up a lavender thong, and heads for his bedroom. However, he decides he doesn’t like his selection and goes back this time picking up a red low-cut silk brief and heads for his room, flexing along the way to prove his masculinity.
Las Vegas, we have the typical glamour shots of Vegas and the strip before we arrive at 4 Queens bar, where Chandler and Monica are sitting at a table waiting for the show to start.

content.speaker: A Waiter in Drag
content.text: Has someone taken your order yet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh oh yeah, she did. Uh, he did. (To Chandler) She? (To the waiter) I’m-I’m sorry I’m new. I don’t…

content.speaker: Waiter in Drag
content.text: Hm-mmm?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I just ordered a beer! (Pounds the table.)

content.speaker: Waiter in Drag
content.text: You’re straight. I get it. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I still say that if we had called your dad we coulda gotten better seats.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! I don’t want him to know we’re here yet! I’m not sure I’m ready for that. And besides, he’s not gonna be too happy to see me either.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know if I’ve told you this, but he’s kinda tried to get in contact with me a lot over the last few years

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, he’s made phone calls, written letters, he even came to New York, but I always said I was too busy to see him. Y’know it’s all very Cats in the Cradle —I don’t want to get into it. (The show starts.) Here we go.

content.speaker: Announcer
content.text: Ladies and gentlemen please welcome the incomparable Helena Handbasket!
(There’s applause as Helena turns around and it’s Kathleen Turner.)

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Hello darlings.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And there’s daddy!

content.description: The Porsche, they have pulled over and are waiting for the cop to come talk to them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Switch places with me! Switch places with me! Come on! I’ll go under, you go over!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’ll get right on that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh come on Ross!! (She tries to switch places with him and goes under his leg.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No Rach! Come on! No-no! Yeah, I’m sure we won’t get arrested for this.
(She sits back up as the policeman approaches. She undoes her top button.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi officer, was I going a little too fast?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Can I see your license please?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yes, absolutely! Y’know, it’s weird uh, but I had a dream last night where I was stopped by a policeman. And then he uh…well I probably shouldn’t tell you the rest.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Your license?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Here you go Officer uh, Handsome.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: That’s Hanson.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oops sorry, my mistake.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dear Lord!!

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here it comes.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: This is a great picture.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! You think so? Y’know, I had just rolled out of bed.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Yeah? Well you look phenomenal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well she should, it was taken ten years ago!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know you’re-you’re probably wondering about the old date on there.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Yes I am.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: You’re an Aquarius, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I bet you’re a Gemini.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Taurus?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Virgo?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sagittarius?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I knew it! I knew it, ahh…

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Well I tell you what…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: You’re not gonna speed anymore right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I won’t speed.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: And you promise you’ll get this taken care of right away?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I promise.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: And in the meantime you better let him drive. Does he have a license?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Can he handle the stick?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can handle the stick!!

content.description: 4 Queens Club, Helena Handbasket is singing.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: I feel pretty. Oh so pretty. I feel pretty and witty and …(She holds the mike out to the audience.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Gay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That can’t be your father.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Believe me, I’ve been saying that for years. Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s Mr. Garibaldi playing the piano.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: For I’m loved by a pretty wonderful boy ! (Applause.) Hello! And welcome to the show. I see some of our regulars in the audience. And a couple of irregulars. (He starts going into the audience.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s coming into the audience. He’s coming into the audience.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Relax! You’ll be fine. (Chandler exhales and turns off the table light.) Oh much better. You’re invisible now.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Where are you from?
content.parenthetical: standing at a table and asking the guy sitting there

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Bakersfield.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: I’m sorry? (Holds out the mike.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Bakersfield!

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: No-no I heard! I’m just sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It can’t happen like this. Okay? I’ll meet you back at the hotel.
(He gets up to walk out, but Helena spots and stops him.)

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Oh look, a standing ovation already! So early in the show. Oh turn around honey; let me see your pretty face. (He slowly turns around. Helena recognizes him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can we have our drinks please?! Waiter—Uh, tress!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Joey enters strutting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs! (He sits down next to her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check it out. (He turns around, pulls down his pants, and shows Phoebe that he’s got panties on.) How much of a man am I?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Nice! Manly and also kind of a slut.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, I’m beginning to see what Jake was talking about.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The silk? Feels really good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! And-and things aren’t as…smashed down as I thought they were gonna be.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s great Joe!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! And you have so many more choices than you do with men’s underwear!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bikini, French cut, thong! And-and the fabrics! You’ve got cotton, silk, lace! And y’know what I’ve always wondered about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pantyhose! Y’know? The way they start at your toe and go all the way up to here… (He mimed that and stops when he realizes he went too far.) I should go take these off shouldn’t I?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think it’s important that you do.
(Joey agrees and heads to take them off.)

content.description: 4 Queens Club, scene continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: So what’s your name?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Chandler. (He quickly sits down.)

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Chandler? What an unusual name! You must’ve had terribly fasc inating parents.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, they’re a hoot.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: And who is your friend?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m-I’m Monica.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Monica! Where are you from?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: New York.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: I’m not very fond of New York. Queens I like. (Noticing Monica’s ring.) Ooh, what is this sparkle something! (Shows the audience who woos.) Honey! Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually Monica and I are engaged.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Really?! Congratulations. When’s the big day?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In…in two weeks.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: I see. Well, I wish you both a life time of happiness. (To a bald guy.) So you’re bald?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait! Wait! We’d really love it if you could be there.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: We? (Looks at Monica who nods.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know it would make me happy, ma’am.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Well I wouldn’t miss it for the world. Oh! I’m getting all misty here! You’d think I was having my legs waxed or something. (Goes back on stage.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Thanks for making me do this.

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: Before we go on with the show, I just want to say to the bride and groom how lucky they are to have found each other. In every life, a little rain must fall. Fortunately, in my life… (Four guys wearing rubber boots, shorts, hats, and nothing else carrying umbrellas run onto the stage.) (Singing) It’s raining men!

content.speaker: The Chorus Line
content.text: Hallelujah!

content.speaker: Helena
content.text: It’s raining men!

content.speaker: The Chorus Line
content.text: Amen !

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When I was growing up I…played the one on the far left.

content.description: The Porsche, cars are whizzing by and honking their horns on both sides very quickly as Ross creeps along.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remind me to introduce you to someone!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fourth gear!!
(Suddenly a siren goes off.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What does he want?! I wasn’t doing anything!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well maybe he saw your hand slip briefly from the ten and two o’clock position.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe it’s uh Sergeant Sagittarius coming back to flirt some more! (They pull over.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a different guy!
(The policeman walks up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good evening officer.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Do you know how fast you were traveling back there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah no. I don’t, but it could not have been more than sixty.

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: You’re right. It was 37. (Rachel laughs.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean you’re not gonna give me a-a ticket for driving too slow are ya?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: That’s right.
(There’s a pause as Ross gets suddenly flirtatious.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know of-officer I uh…I had the weirdest dream last night…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: Your license please.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t-you don’t want to hear about my dream Officer…Pretty?

content.speaker: Policeman
content.text: It’s Petty. (He grabs Ross’s license.) I’ll be right back with your ticket. (Walks back to his car.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have a son!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. I know.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is returning from having removed Rachel’s panties.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Feel better?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Much! Listen uh, not that I’m y’know insecure about my manhood or anything y’know, but I think I need to hook up with a woman like right now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I understand.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Okay! (He notices a beautiful woman sitting behind the couch and goes to talk to her.) Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, you look familiar. Do I know you from somewhere?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Maybe it’s because I’m on television. I’m an actor on Days of Our Lives .

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: $4.50 please.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, let me get this. (He takes out his wallet, but the panties come with it. The woman and waitress are shocked.) (Realizing) (To the woman) These are for you.
